Instrument.name: LIDAR High-Resolution Imager for CLEM1
Instrument.description:
The High Resolution Imaging (HIRES) camera is an advanced imaging system that integrates a lightweight beryllium telescope with an image intensifier and charge-coupled device (CCD) imager. It features a maximum integration time of 733 milliseconds, with a spectral response range of 0.4 to 0.8 microns and the ability to select from five spectral bands. The camera was specifically designed for high-resolution imaging of lunar poles, achieving resolutions between 10 to 15 meters per pixel.
Operational decisions were made to preserve the instrument's life, leading to lower exposure settings and limited imaging during lunar observations, particularly at mid-latitudes. As a result, most mid-latitude images were deemed unusable. It utilized JPEG compression due to nonuniformity issues in the images and photon shot noise, impacting overall image quality.
The camera underwent pre-launch calibration and was geometrically calibrated against a lunar control network during the mission, with minimal optical distortion. Various operational modes, including programmable integration time, gain, and offset settings, allowed for flexibility in capturing images across different lunar terrains. The specifications of the HIRES camera include a pixel format of 288x384, a readout rate of 4 MHz, and various filter capabilities for diverse imaging requirements.
